name: Julia Fangman
bio: I am currently a Cyber Crimes Case Manager with academic training in Criminal Justice and Data Analytics, experienced in investigative support, data-driven decision-making, and cross-agency coordination. Committed to advancing mission-driven organizations throughethical service, strategic analysis, and a passion for public good.

education.title: B.S. in Criminal Justice, Minors in Psychology & Business Administration
Big Brothers Big Sisters of America

bullets: Manage investigative data and intelligence analysis to support cybercrime cases across local and state systems.
Prepare leads and case documentation to assist law enforcement officers and prosecutors.
Coordinate cross-agency information sharing and digital evidence handling.
Led a team of counselors in delivering recreational and sports activities for children ages 5–11.
Promoted teamwork, discipline, and positive personal growth among campers.
Prepared and served high-quality coffee and beverages in a fast-paced environment.
Provided friendly customer service while managing cash and point-of-sale operations.
Maintained cleanliness, organization, and efficiency during peak service hours.
Supervised and supported adolescents (ages 14–20) in rehabilitation programs.
Balanced structure and empathy to encourage rehabilitation and positive outcomes.

projects.name: Recidivism Data Analysis Project
projects.description: Capstone project analyzing recidivism rates and disparities in sentencing outcomes in the U.S. justice system. Integrated machine learning models and Tableau visualizations to identify predictive factors of recidivism.
